page.title: 06HOUSING IN ATWORTH
page.content: HOUSING_POPULATION The population of the Atworth area stands at approximately 1000 and has increased little over the years.This is in the main due to the drainage.Any substantial increase in building would neccestate a new sewer at very high cost.So infill housing has been the rule. The majority of houses are owner_occupied while there are some tied cottages and a small amount of council accomodation.The elderley are provided for at Shell Court,a Local Authority sheltered housing block. The ages of the population was surveyed,by the History Group & the chilren from Atworth school,in 1978.80% of people were found to be over 16,an ageing population but one that is still able to support a school.
